bibl.title: Ancient Alexandria between Egypt and Greece.

series.title: Columbia Studies in the Classical Tradition.

bibl.note: 13 papers presented at a conference organized by the Center for the Ancient Mediterranean at Columbia University on October 11th and 12th, 2002. - Pp. vii-ix: W.V.H. and G.R., Preface; - 269-289: Bibliography; - 291-294: Index of Subjects; - 295-296: Index of Papyri.
bibl.seg: HARRIS William V. and Giovanni RUFFINI (Edd.), Ancient Alexandria between Egypt and Greece. (Columbia Studies in the Classical Tradition. 26.)
Leiden, E.J. Brill, 2004, 8°, xx-296 pp., tabl., graphiques, 3 cartes et 30 pll. ISBN 90-04-14105-7. €75.

13 papers presented at a conference organized by the Center for the Ancient Mediterranean at Columbia University on October 11th and 12th, 2002. - Pp. vii-ix: W.V.H. and G.R., Preface; - 269-289: Bibliography; - 291-294: Index of Subjects; - 295-296: Index of Papyri.

C.R. par Martin Bommas, MusHelv 63 (2006) p. 245. - Andrew Erskine, CR N.S., 56 (2006) pp. 454-456. - Georges Nachtergael, ChrEg 80 (2005) Nos 159-160, pp. 353-355. - Dorothy J. Thompson, JRA 19 (2006) pp. 426-428. - Marjorie Susan Venit, BMCRev < http://ccat.sas.upenn.edu/bmcr/2005/2005-07-62.html >. - Judith S. McKenzie, JHS 127 (2007) pp. 231-233 [concerne aussi: Niall FINNERAN, Alexandria: A City and Myth (Stroud, 2005); - László TÖRÖK, Transfigurations of Hellenism. Aspects of Late Antique Art in Egypt AD 250-700 (Leiden, 2005)]. - Jean A. Straus, AntCl 76 (2007) pp. 516-517.
